intro: Pedicularis croizatiana, commonly known as the Croizat's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often resembling those of orchids. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
